intro: Stenurus tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaf stenurus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
